document.docAuthor: Arai, Hisao P. & Smith, John W.
document.masterDocTitle: Guide to the Parasites of Fishes of Canada Part V: Nematoda

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Guide to the Parasites of Fishes of Canada Part V: Nematoda

subSubSection.paragraph:
Comments: larvae from fresh-water fishes probably represent either *
C. rudolphii
or *
C. spiculigerum
, whilst

those from marine fishes probably represent *
C. osculatum
, or *
Contracaecum
and/or *
Phocascaris
.
Sites: alimentary tract, body cavity, mesenteries, musculature

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 77. *
Contracaecum spiculigerum
(Rudolphi, 1809) Railliet & Henry, 1912
. A. L3, anterior end, lateral view; B. L3, posterior end, lateral view. (Redrawn from Huizinga 1966).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution: Alberta , Atlantic, British Columbia , Labrador, Manitoba , New Brunswick , Newfoundland, Nova Scotia , NorthwestTerritories, Ontario ,
Prince Edward Island
, Quebec , Saskatchewan
